alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:05PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Columbia, east central Suwannee and southern Hamilton Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 505 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mcalpin, or 12 miles west of Lake City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, penny size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake City, White Springs, Wellborn, Five Points, Winfield, Suwannee Valley and Mcalpin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee
